New Records: Jackson Chourio's 449-foot homer is the longest by any Brewer this season.
Key Match Events: Mike Yastrzemski hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning to put the Giants ahead for good in a 5-4 victory over the Brewers.
Matt Chapman went 3 for 4 with a solo home run, bolstering the Giants' offense.
Grant McCray also homered for the Giants.
Milwaukee's Willy Adames and Jackson Chourio hit towering two-run homers off Giants starter Logan Webb.
Camilo Doval retired Chourio on a fly to deep center to end a bases-loaded threat in the sixth inning.
Ryan Walker earned his fourth save in eight opportunities by retiring Perkins on a fly to right.
Post-Match Reflections: Grant McCray commented on the importance of winning one-run games as the Giants push for a wild-card spot.
Giants manager Bob Melvin praised the team's ability to put pressure on a strong Brewers bullpen.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Blake Perkins of the Brewers made a homer-preventing catch in the fifth inning, his fourth of the season.
Christian Yelich of the Brewers spoke to reporters for the first time since undergoing season-ending back surgery, expressing optimism about his recovery.
